solid metroidvania game it can be a bit tough here and there but its pretty simple for the most part soundtrack is pretty good too recommend it

this is a pretty fun little metroidvania that i think deserves a lot more attention than what its getting great style tight controls and a story thats fun and nonintrusive the only real downfall is one tremendously annoying boss battle about halfway through the game where youll be dying repeatedly because you cant see where youre going and getting back to the boss is a long dull slog of a climb  otherwise good stuff and its not like silksong is coming out ever right
fun game

a great retro feeling game that brings the difficulty but isnt so hard you feel like youre going to lose your soul playing this game my only complaint is that it was too short i really could have pumped way more hours into this

maybe just not for me  i found the controls to be very wishywashy and spongy some of the map layout and save points feel like an afterthought and not very well placed   despite making progress i just didnt feel like i was having fun
ok game

a decent bite size metroidvania combat is pretty basic and you get some range weapons later on that can also be used in aiding your movement but the katana is your primary weapon throughout the game i dont think any game has been negatively received because it has a grappling hook no matter the game swinging around as a form of traversal is really satisfying and this game is no different if you want a quick weekend game to play i would recommend picking this one up

its painfully short and mediocre everywhere else i had some fun i didnt beat the game fought the final boss a few times and said out loud what am i doing and stopped out of boredom the game is built around a pretty creative concept that is somehow underutilized none of the bosses were fun or interesting some were just obnoxious theres better games out there i wouldnt bother

music  awesome grafics  awesome movementcontrol  awesome  performance on low spec hardware  awesome   the only negativ point is that the mountain boss had no checkpoint after the 1st phase and if you die youll have to repeat it over and over again but for me that was really the only downside   one of the best metroidvanias out there

although not one of my favorite metroidvanias of all time kunai does bring a handful of unique ideas to the table with the well kunai you use to swing around or slingshot up places and it feels really nice to handle the air hovering with the smgs and stunning with shurikens is interesting too despite being outclassed by the rocket launcher for the most part overall a nice package with very few setbacks in total
not a fan of metroidvanias but this was fun id get a sequel if that ever comes out

tight and responsive gameplay with a fun movementmechanic imaginative and distinctive artstyle and world not a true metroidvania but that only works to its benefit so the pacing bosses items etc are all intentional and meaningful the style and dialogue are so playful with a strong sense of humor throughout well worth your timemoney if the demo appeals to you
imagine hollow knight but it doesnt overstay its welcome and make me drop the game halfway oh and swinging around is fun

fun action platformer the only negative so far is the artstyle which i have mixed feelings on particularly the main character i do enjoy the visuals overall though and like the use of a limited colour pallet

a very overlooked little gem that sort of reminds me of a mix between megaman and hollow knight pretty fun my only complaint is that the watercolor look is sometimes too bright and requires some backlighting or dimming of the monitor

i enjoyed the platforming and the premise of collecting hats you get movement upgrades pretty fast in my opinion although i have not played too many games of this genre  unfortunately i got a headache from the low contrast color palette i can appreciate the style though if you arent too bothered by the colors in in the screenshots youll be fine the rest of the game probably

decent short metroidvania some cool weapons and abilities charged slash is nutty and fun my only critiscism is the backtracking when looking to mop up completion no fast travel and going back through some of the levels is a slog needed an upgrade or map indicator where you could locate the final chests

this game is a fun little platformer feeling like a ninja in a technological dystopian future fight the bad guys and uncover the secrets of the violent world you boot up in i beat the game in 78 hours its short but its fun the story is charming and pretty hilarious at times also there are hidden collectables for completionists i have zero complaints its fun

it feels criminal that i got this game for only a dollar a little challenging at first due to the movement mechanics though once you learn it you are soon whizzing around the map gorgeous pixel art with much attention to detail pairing with fitting choice colors
